channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil Prices Fall as Demand Outlook Remains Gloomy
item.description: Oil ticked lower after sliding on Friday, with higher global supply against a weak demand outlook keeping bearish investors in charge of the energy ma...

item.title: Disney stock surges on streaming growth, guidance
item.description: Revenue for Disney's entertainment segment – which includes the traditional TV networks, direct-to-consumer streaming and films – increased 14% year o...

item.title: Gold Futures Rise on Cooling U.S. Dollar, Easing Profit-Taking
item.description: Gold futures were up, after the U.S. presidential election triggered nearly two weeks of profit-taking, SP Angel said, as Trump’s presumed inflationar...

item.title: Cisco reports fourth straight quarter of declining revenue
item.description: Cisco reported better-than-expected results for the latest quarter but revenue continues to shrink.

item.title: Alibaba posts profit beat as China looks to prop up tepid consumer spend
item.description: The results come at a tricky time for Chinese commerce businesses, given the broad sluggishness in the world's second-largest economy.

item.title: Euro Might Fall if Eurozone PMI Data Are Weak

item.title: Disney doesn't plan to change its TV networks portfolio anytime soon
item.description: Disney doesn't foresee parting with its TV networks, more than a year after CEO Bob Iger went public with the consideration.

item.title: Here's why investors are so excited about Disney's quarterly results
item.description: After several quarters of underperformance and investor frustration, CEO Robert Iger's turnaround plans appear to be working.

item.description: The chip maker’s earnings day has become a major event on Wall Street, drawing comparisons with Fed meetings and key economic reports for their influe...

item.title: Nasdaq Futures Gain in Early Trading
item.description: Stock futures tied to the Nasdaq-100 and the S&P 500 edged up, while Dow industrials futures slipped.
